meanings.definition: To receive more votes than (someone or something) in a poll.
meanings.sent1: In the school election, Sarah managed to outpoll her opponent and win the position of class president.
meanings.sent2: The new proposal managed to outpoll the old one by a significant margin.
meanings.sent3: The race for the best ice cream flavor turned intense when vanilla outpolled chocolate unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: The underdog team outpolled the reigning champions, shocking everyone with their victory.
meanings.sent5: The catchy jingle helped the product outpoll its competitors and become the top choice among consumers.

meanings.definition: To surpass in number of votes received in a poll.
meanings.sent1: The popular movie outpolled all others at the box office this weekend.
meanings.sent2: Her performance in the talent show outpolled the other contestants, earning her the first prize.
meanings.sent3: The quirky mascot of the team managed to outpoll the traditional mascot in the fan vote.
meanings.sent4: The new campaign strategy outpolled the previous one, leading to a landslide victory.
meanings.sent5: The innovative product design outpolled its competitors, capturing the attention of the market.
